results.title: Revenge of a kinematograph cameraman
results.creator_credit: Ladislas Starevich and British Film Institute
results.brief_description: Provides an example of an early animated puppet film by Ladislas Starevich, a young Polish artist, who gained international recognition for his pioneering work in animated and trick films. Starevich worked at one time for the Khanzhonkov, a Russian studio, but later emigrated to Paris. His work had a light, satirical touch, which in those days, was almost unique among Russian film-makers. Also known as ‘The Cameraman’s Revenge’ Mrs Beetle is involved with a grasshopper artist while Mr Beetle is seeing a dragonfly cabaret performer! An intricate drama of (f)lies, deceit and the just revenge of the cinematographer. One of Starewicz earlier films, possibly the very first cinematic treatment of insect fidelity.

results.title: Rev
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and colour and audio
results.brief_description: This painterly observation of pedestrian traffic through a revolving door finds a counterpoint in the flickering of a candle flame. As separate lives are blurred with the energy of constant movement, individuals merge into an abstracted urban sound and light space.
results.description: This painterly observation of pedestrian traffic through a revolving door finds a counterpoint in the flickering of a candle flame. As separate lives are blurred with the energy of constant movement, individuals merge into an abstracted urban sound and light space.

results.title: Reunion in France
results.creator_credit: Jules Dassin, Joseph L Mankiewicz and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Frenchwoman Michele de la Becque (Joan Crawford) is a pampered Parisian whose high society lifestyle abruptly changes with the Nazi invasion of Paris. A downed RAF pilot on the run - Pat Talbot (John Wayne), enters her world seeking asylum, which Michele provides by hiding him in her tiny apartment. His escape however is reliant on the co-operation of Michele’s rich industrialist finace Robert Corlot (Phillip Dorn) - who may also be a Nazi collaborator, a situation which is fraught with danger when love and allegiance are on the line. Cast also includes Reginald Owen, Albert Bassermann and John Carradine.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jules Dassin, Joseph L Mankiewicz and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer

results.title: Reunion
results.creator_credit: Lisa Wang and Black Sheep Films
results.brief_description: This is an intimate and moving exploration of growing up in a Chinese-Australian family. Lisa Wang’s maternal family has been prominent in Victorian Chinese affairs for a century. Her father built the David Wang retail empire and became one of Melbourne’s best loved civic identities, after arriving in Australia as a Chinese Army officer who spoke no English, The film uses a mass of fascinating archival footage which stretches from early attempts by family members to learn to use a 16mm Bell & Howell projector given in payment of a debt, through professional images of store openings, to home video of Lisa’s journey to Taiwan and China.

results.title: Reuben, Reuben
results.creator_credit: Robert Ellis Miller, Walter Shenson and Taft Entertainment
results.brief_description: A Scottish poet past his prime has become an alcoholic and is dining off past glories, whilst living in an New England town. His penchant for successfully bedding a string of bored local wives, waylaying them with seductive poetry and sexual finesse, is derailed upon his encounter with the wholesome student Geneva Spofford (Kelly McGillis). Tom Conti plays Gowan McGland as an artist filled with self-loathing whose inability to recognise an opportunity for happiness makes him a tragic figure. Despite its at time depressing subject matter, “Reuben, Reuben” is an amusing romantic comedy about artistic drive and mis-matched lovers.

results.title: Returns from space
results.creator_credit: United States. National Aeronautics Space Administration
results.brief_description: Some of the varied “Spinoff” benefits and products of space research and development are demonstrated. These include use of sensors for monitoring hospital patients, devices which aid the disabled, the uses of freeze-dried foods for campers, new technological tools and materials, and microminiaturisation of electronic components.

results.title: Return to the sea: a saga of survival
results.creator_credit: Martin McGrath, Ian McFadyen and Comedia
results.brief_description: A humorous parody of David Attenborough’s “Life on earth” documentaries. Our suburban mode of existence with its annual return to the beach resorts is likened to the ritualistic behaviour of members of the animal kingdom. Raises issues about the way we define the behaviour of cultures different from our own. Contains an early performance by Steve Vizard.

results.title: Return to the mountains
results.brief_description: Shows Sir Edmund Hillary’s return to the Everest area to establish a school. Illustrates the work of the Sherpa guides, and some aspects of life of the Nepalese. Narrated by Sir Edmund Hillary.
